pull.title: build: set --build when configuring packages in depends
pull.body:
After reading [#Specifying-Target-Triplets](https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/autoconf/manual/autoconf-2.69/autoconf.html#Specifying-Target-Triplets) in the autoconf manuel, my understanding is that this change should mostly be a no-op, as `--build` defaults to the output of [`config.guess`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/depends/config.guess), however, this may be slightly more correct

>  For historical reasons, whenever you specify --host, be sure to specify --build too; this will be fixed in the future.

and will quell some warnings in depends (#16354), i.e:
> configure: WARNING: If you wanted to set the --build type, don't use --host.
    If a cross compiler is detected then cross compile mode will be used.

If anything, this also explicitly enables cross-compilation mode when `--host` differs from `--build`. As for "fixed in the future", this is the case for Autoconf 2.70+.

If we don't make this change, I think we should consider closing #16354. We've now got a good handle on our depends configure flags, and we can just leave the last few warnings as they are. It's also unlikely that we are going to add the `xorg-macros` package to depends.

Concept ACK. The same idea was in my TODO list.

Tested 4f91544c4d2910ae0fd3a356e3c2e785ab1c818c on Linux Mint 20.1 (x86_64).

On master:
```
$ make -C depends libXau_configured
...
Configuring libXau...
configure: WARNING: if you wanted to set the --build type, don't use --host.
    If a cross compiler is detected then cross compile mode will be used
...


$ make -C depends bdb_configured
...
Configuring bdb...
configure: WARNING: If you wanted to set the --build type, don't use --host.
    If a cross compiler is detected then cross compile mode will be used.
...
```

No such warnings with this PR.

Concept ACK!

-----

Wondering if it would be better to place the context documentation in the file rather than in the git message. Locating git messages/PRs can become difficult if a line gets changed often and moved around.

verification.payload:
tree b3e1e25af199d5cf4eee0f9f610188d79ea14ff8
parent b14462083f82aeaa9a376978f210db5538db296f
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1615347754 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1617181552 +0800

build: set --build when configuring packages in depends

After reading
https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/autoconf/manual/autoconf-2.70/autoconf.html#Specifying-Target-Triplets,
my understanding is that this change should mostly be a no-op, as
--build defaults to the output of config.guess, however, this may be
slightly more correct
>  For historical reasons, whenever you specify --host, be sure to
> specify --build too; this will be fixed in the future.

and will quell some warnings in depends (#16354). If anything, this
also explicitly enables cross-compilation mode when `--host` differs
from `--build`.

As for "fixed in the future", this is the case for Autoconf 2.70+.

events.message:
build: set --build when configuring packages in depends

After reading
https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/autoconf/manual/autoconf-2.70/autoconf.html#Specifying-Target-Triplets,
my understanding is that this change should mostly be a no-op, as
--build defaults to the output of config.guess, however, this may be
slightly more correct
>  For historical reasons, whenever you specify --host, be sure to
> specify --build too; this will be fixed in the future.

and will quell some warnings in depends (#16354). If anything, this
also explicitly enables cross-compilation mode when `--host` differs
from `--build`.

As for "fixed in the future", this is the case for Autoconf 2.70+.

issue.title: build: Review of depends tree configure flags
issue.body:
While doing depends builds, I noticed that there are many configure flags that weren't recognized by our packages. This leads to things like: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16183. This is most likely caused by either overzealous configure flag adding, or updating depends packages without looking at changes to accepted configure flags.

I propose that we:
1. Prune configure flags from depends that packages don't understand.
2. Add documentation on updating packages (namely that new configure flags should be checked).
3. (stretch-goal) Find out what `--without-` and `--disable-` configure flags we can supply to speed up depends builds.

CC @fanquake @theuni

comments.body:
From Autoconf [manual](https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/autoconf/manual/autoconf-2.69/autoconf.html#Specifying-Target-Triplets):
>  It defaults to the result of running `config.guess`.

In our code https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/e0bc27a14ceb18bfe3dd9ebdae6bef447c4ec922/depends/Makefile#L69

Could this cause any subtle problems?
